Getting Started with pepr

Nathan Sheffield

2018-10-25

gettingStarted.Rmd

Load pepr and read in your project.

library('pepr')
projectConfig = system.file("extdata",
"example_peps-master",
"example_basic",
"project_config.yaml",
package = "pepr")
p = Project(file = projectConfig)
## Loaded config file:  
## /Library/Frameworks/R.framework/Versions/3.5/Resources/library/pepr/extdata/example_peps-master/example_basic/project_config.yaml
## Warning in makeMetadataSectionAbsolute(cfg, parent = dirname(filename)):
## Value for 'output_dir' doesn't exist: '/Users/mstolarczyk/
## hello_looper_results'
## Loading required namespace: data.table

Here’s how you can access the metadata:

samples(p)
##    sample_name       library                file
## 1:      frog_1 anySampleType data/frog1_data.txt
## 2:      frog_2 anySampleType data/frog2_data.txt
config(p)
## PEP project object. Class: Config
##  metadata:
##     sample_annotation: 
## /Library/Frameworks/R.framework/Versions/3.5/Resources/library/pepr/extdata/example_peps-master/example_basic/sample_annotation.csv
##     output_dir: /Users/mstolarczyk/hello_looper_results
##  name: example_basic
